intro: Mastixia tetrapetala, commonly known as the four-petaled mastixia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive four-petaled white to pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in a fine, white pubescence. Mastixia tetrapetala is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and dry forests.
